intro: Wedelia pseudoyedaea, commonly known as the narrowleaf wedelia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a low, spreading shrub with small, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and restoration projects.
